revised_title: Family Likeness in Stature: A Statistical Analysis
tldr: The author, Francis Galton, investigates the relationship between the statures of specified individuals and their kin in various degrees. He explains the processes through which family peculiarities of stature gradually diminish, eventually becoming indistinguishable from a random group of people. The study focuses on the ease of measuring and the constancy of stature during adulthood, making it an excellent subject for hereditary inquiry.
